arm_group.description: education of rehabilitation officers in psychiatric topics plus rehabilitation as usual

brief_summary.textblock:
The hypothesis was that education of rehabilitation officers who were responsible for
      rehabilitation back to work for sick-listed individuals in screening for mental disorders
      and psychiatric topics would increase the rate of return to work and reduce the number of
      sicklisted days

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Psychiatric Knowledge in the Rehabilitation Process in Return to Work.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  sick-listed and belonging to the case-load of rehabilitation officers who
             participated in the intervention

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  no

intervention.description: Education as add on to to rehabilitation as usual

facility.name: Psychiatric Research Unit West, Regional Psychiatric Services West

clinical_study.official_title: Application of Psychiatric Knowledge in the Rehabilitation Process in Return to Work.

primary_outcome.description: The rate of return to work was estimated by Poisson regression and Cox regression based on the duration from the date being sicklisted until the date of return to normal work.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: After eight weeks of continuous sickness absence the number of sickness absence days within ½ year was counted

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
